paper_abstract: Let Q be a set of unsatisfiable clauses, an implicit resolution refutation of Q is a circuit fi with a resolution proof a of the statement "fi describes a correct tree-like resolution refutation of Q". We show that such a system is p-equivalent to Extended Frege. More generally, let T be a tautology, a [P, Q]-proof of T is a pair (cx, fi) s.t. a is a P-proof of the statement "fi is a circuit describing a correct Q-proof of T". We prove that [EF, P] <, [R, P] for an arbitrary Cook-Reckhow proof system P.
